ENG.q: Would you like a new beginning?
ENG.a: Overall no, however I would be interested in going through my life again knowing what I know now. That way I could see how much impact certain decisions have made on my life.

ENG.q: Who will remember you in 1000 years?
ENG.a: Most likely no one. Potentially I’ll be a name in medical history as I was the first baby to have a bone-marrow transplant whilst still inside the womb. Although the person being remem- bered would be my godfather who performed the procedure, Professor Kypros Nicolaides.

ENG.q: What kind of pandemic would you like next?
ENG.a: Something that is only lethal for dictators.

ENG.q: How do you hurt your loved ones?
ENG.a: Forgetting birthdays and forgetting to stay in contact on a more regular basis.

ENG.q: When was the last time you cried and why?
ENG.a: Watching S2 E5 of Derek. I don’t wish to spoil the story!

EST.a: Üldiselt mitte, aga huvitav oleks oma elu uuesti kogeda, teades seda, mida ma praegu tean. Sellisel moel võiksin näha, kui palju on teatud otsused minu elukäiku mõjutanud.

Ilmselt mitte keegi. Võimalik, et mu nimi läheb kirja meditsiiniajalukku, kuna olin esimene beebi, kellele teostati veel emaüsas luuüdi siir- damine. Ilmselt mäletatakse inimest, kes selle protseduuri läbi viis – mu ristiisa professor Kypros Nicolaidest.
Midagi sellist, mis oleks surmav vaid diktaatoritele.

EST.q: Kuidas sa oma kõige kallimatele inimestele haiget teed?
EST.a: Ma unustan sünnipäevi ja unustan tihedamini suhelda.

EST.q: Millal sa viimati nutsid ja miks?
EST.a: Siis kui vaatasin seriaali „Derek“ 2. hooaja 5. episoodi. Ma ei taha lugu ära rääkida!
